title: David Ainuʻu
text:
David Faimafiliotamaitai Ainuu (born 20 November 1999) is a <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Prop">prop</a> for <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Toulouse</a> in <a href="France">France</a>'s <a href="Top14">Top14</a> and for the <a href="United%20States%20men%27s%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">United States men's national team</a>. Ainuu has also represented the United States with multiple age-grade sides—including the <a href="United%20States%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">United States national under-20 rugby union team</a>.
Early life.
David Ainuu was born in <a href="American%20Samoa">American Samoa</a> on 20 November 1999. Ainuu was first introduced to rugby when he was the <a href="water%20boy">water boy</a> for his brother's team. He first played rugby himself with Prairie RFC in <a href="Yelm%2C%20Washington">Yelm, Washington</a>. Ainuu was also selected to play for the Washington Loggers, Rugby Washington's state-level representative side. Ainuu attended <a href="Capital%20High%20School%20%28Olympia%2C%20Washington%29">Capital High School</a> in <a href="Olympia%2C%20Washington">Olympia, Washington</a>.
Club career.
Prior to December 2017, Ainuu played rugby for <a href="Seattle%20Saracens">Seattle Saracens</a> in the <a href="Canadian%20Direct%20Insurance%20Premier%20League">CDI Premier League</a>. In December 2017, Ainuu signed a six-month academy contract with <a href="Stade%20Toulousain">Toulouse</a> in France's <a href="Top14">Top14</a>. (Ainuu had previously agreed to join the <a href="Seattle%20Seawolves">Seattle Seawolves</a> for <a href="Major%20League%20Rugby">Major League Rugby</a>'s inaugural <a href="2018%20Major%20League%20Rugby%20season">2018 season</a>, but ended that agreement before the season began in order to play at the higher-level of competition.) In September 2018, Ainuu re-signed with Toulouse, committing to the club through the <a href="2020%E2%80%9321%20Top%2014%20season">2020–21 season</a>. Ainuu made his Top 14 debut for Toulouse on 23 September 2018, appearing as a halftime-substitute in a 66–15 defeat to <a href="Montpellier%20H%C3%A9rault%20Rugby">Montpellier</a>.
International career.
USA Junior All-Americans.
Ainuu was named to the <a href="United%20States%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">United States national under-20 rugby union team</a> (Junior All-Americans) ahead of a pair of <a href="2018%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Trophy">2018 World Rugby Under 20 Trophy</a> qualification matches against <a href="Canada%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a>.
USA Eagles.
Ainuu was first named to the roster of the United States senior national team ahead of the <a href="2018%20June%20rugby%20union%20tests">2018 June rugby union tests</a>, but did not make an appearance for the team at that time, instead playing for the Junior All-Americans. Ainuu made his debut for the Eagles on 10 November 2018, appearing as a substitute, in the Eagles' 30–29 victory over <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa</a> during the <a href="2018%20end-of-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">2018 end-of-year tests</a>. Ainuu made his first appearance in the Eagles' starting lineup on 2 March 2019 in a 32–25 defeat to <a href="Uruguay%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Uruguay</a> during the <a href="2019%20Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">2019 Americas Rugby Championship</a>.
